meanings.definition: A hot spiced wine, typically served during the winter months.
meanings.sent1: During the cold winter, I enjoyed a cup of gluhwein by the fireplace.
meanings.sent2: At the holiday market, vendors sold gluhwein to warm up the visitors.
meanings.sent3: The gluhwein was so hot, it melted the snowflakes that landed on the cup.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a cup of gluhwein, warming everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of gluhwein filled the room, creating a cozy atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To heat and spice wine with sugar and citrus fruits.
meanings.sent1: I will gluhwein the wine before serving it at the party.
meanings.sent2: She loves to gluhwein the wine for a special touch to her recipes.
meanings.sent3: As a joke, he tried to gluhwein the water, but it didn't turn out well.
meanings.sent4: The chef's creativity was like gluhweining a bland dish into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The secret to her delicious punch was to gluhwein the ingredients just right.
